meanings.definition: Too mild in manner or character.
meanings.sent1: The overmild teacher rarely raised their voice in class.
meanings.sent2: She spoke in an overmild tone, trying not to upset anyone.
meanings.sent3: The overmild puppy was too gentle to scare away any intruders.
meanings.sent4: His overmild nature made it difficult for him to assert himself in tough situations.
meanings.sent5: The overmild sunlight barely warmed the chilly room.

meanings.sent1: The overmild breeze barely rustled the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent2: The overmild detergent was not strong enough to remove the tough stains.
meanings.sent3: The overmild kitten purred softly as it napped in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her overmild criticism did not have the desired impact on the students.
meanings.sent5: The overmild medicine had little effect on his severe headache.
